subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] online RP pronunciation dictionary
msgSnippet: ... The EPD, at http://seas3.elte.hu/epd.html , is based on the Oxford Advanced Learner s Dictionary, which apparently was once available from the Oxford Text
messageBody:
Benct Philip Jonsson scripsit:

> On 2008-10-19 peter_r_guinness wrote:
> > Does anyone here know of any online RP pronunciation
> > dictionary/resources?
>
> On the contrary I do think I know for a fact
> that there is none.


The EPD, at http://seas3.elte.hu/epd.html , is based on the
Oxford Advanced Learner's Dictionary, which apparently was once
available from the Oxford Text Archive. There is an online lookup
and downloadable files. The current OALD is searchable online at
http://www.oup.com/oald-bin/web_getald7index1a.pl .

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://ccil.org/~cowan
Heckler: "Go on, Al, tell 'em all you know. It won't take long."
Al Smith: "I'll tell 'em all we *both* know. It won't take any longer."
